meanings.definition: The process of making someone or something more sensitive or responsive to a stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The sensitisation of the skin to sunlight can cause sunburn.
meanings.sent2: The sensitisation of the taste buds made the food taste even better.
meanings.sent3: After the sensitisation to spicy food, even a mild salsa felt like a fire in the mouth.
meanings.sent4: The sensitisation of the mind to new ideas opened up a world of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The sensitisation of the nerves heightened the sense of touch to a remarkable level.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming sensitized or aware of something.
meanings.sent1: The sensitisation to the dangers of smoking led him to quit.
meanings.sent2: Her sensitisation to the beauty of nature grew with each walk in the park.
meanings.sent3: The sensitisation to the loud alarm clock made waking up a jolting experience.
meanings.sent4: His sensitisation to the suffering of others inspired him to volunteer at the shelter.
meanings.sent5: The sensitisation to the importance of recycling changed her habits for the better.
